CommandDefinition.Name: createpackage
CommandDefinition.Description: Creates a package containing all elements specified within the package definition file and the elements' dependencies.
CommandDefinition.ExtendedDescription: The xml file looks like this: <XynaPackage> <Workflow>mdmPath.WorkflowName</Workflow> <Datatype>mdmPath.DatatypeName</Datatype> <ExceptionType>mdmPath.ExceptionName</ExceptionType> <Trigger>triggerName</Trigger> <Filter>filterName</Filter> <Capacity>capacityName</Capacity> <CronLSOrder>id</CronLSOrder> <XynaProperty>propertyName</XynaProperty> <File>pathReleativeToXynaDir.filename</File> </XynaPackage> All elements inside of the XML tag XynaPackage are optional and may occur more than once. Dependencies (subworkflows, datatypes, etc.) will automatically be included in the package. This can be circumvented by setting the ignoreDependencies attribute like this: <Workflow ignoreDependencies="true">mdmPath.WorkflowName</Workflow>

Argument.Name: DeliveryItem
Argument.Description: The definition of the package to be created

Argument.Name: TargetFile
Argument.Description: The file that the created package is written to

BoolOption.Name: i
BoolOption.Description: Include Xyna components within the package
